title: Biden’s COP26 Strategy Is to Blame China and Russia While Securing Climate Deals
sub_head: China’s unwillingness to further narrow climate difference emboldens U.S. officials to call out Beijing, Moscow
body:
GLASGOW—President Biden returned home from the United Nations climate summit Wednesday, having used the opening days of the conference here to try to paint China and Russia as isolated holdouts to a global consensus over fighting climate change.
The president has staked his legacy at home and abroad in part on his ability to rally the international community to address climate change. But Washington and allies such as the U.K. and the European Union failed to get China, Russia and other big polluters to strengthen what the West sees as too-modest emissions-cutting commitments ahead of the summit, called COP26.
